terminologie_extrait.definition: shots that set up the first shot in a rally
terminologie_extrait.contexte: used to control play and set up first shot in a rally

debutant.description: Serve to the side your opponent is weaker on, and prepare to block their shot.
Vary your serves and receives to keep the opponent guessing and off guard.

exercices_complementaires.nom: Short serve to forehand and quick block to backhand
exercices_complementaires.description: Serve short to the forehand, and then quickly block their flip to the backhand.

exercices_complementaires.nom: Deep serve to backhand and quick block to forehand
exercices_complementaires.description: Serve deep to the backhand, and then quickly block their flip to the forehand.

metriques_progression.description: Vary your serves and receives to keep the opponent guessing and off guard.

erreurs_a_eviter.description: Don't receive predictably; vary your receives to keep the opponent off guard.
